body.p:
Paris, Kentucky
7th April 1864
To His Excellency Gov Bramlette
Sir:
I am informed by Lieut Col Jas T. Bramlette 12th Ky Cavalry, that a recommendation has been forwarded to your Excellency, urging Erastus M Gates for a position in some Ky Regiment --

I would respectully represent to your Excellency that the said Gates tendered his resignation as 1st Lieut of Co "G" 45th Ky by my my direction -- His resignation was accepted "for the good of the Service" and he fraudulently procured an order from Gen Sturgiss under which he drew the pay that had been stopped against him --
I therefore more earnestly protest, to your Excellency, against the re-appointment of the said E. M. Gates to any position in any Kentucky Regiment --

I have the honor to be
Yr Excellency's most obdt servt
Jno. Mason Brown
Col 45 Ky Mtd Infy Vols

45
Paris Ky
7th April 1864
Gates E M
Brown Jno M
Col. 45th Infty
Protests against the recommendation and appointment of E M Gates to any position in the Ky service, as he was discharged from the 45th for the good of the service
